Pre-Game Insights: The Indiana Pacers have won three in a row since the calendar flipped to 2025 and hold a winning record for the first time since winning the season opener.
Tyrese Haliburton scored 23 points, Bennedict Mathurin scored 20 points, and Pascal Siakam scored 19 points in the Pacers' recent 113-99 road victory over the Brooklyn Nets.
Bennedict Mathurin has recorded double-figure scoring in eight straight games and is shooting a career-high 46.6 percent from the field in 37 contests this season.
Mathurin's 16.7 points per game match a career-best.
Siakam averages 19.6 points per game and Haliburton averages 18.4 points per game.
The Chicago Bulls have won four of their last five games, including a comeback home win over the San Antonio Spurs.
Zach LaVine had 35 points, 10 rebounds, and eight assists in the win against the Spurs.
Coby White's layup gave the Bulls a one-point lead with 47 seconds left, and he later dunked over Victor Wembanyama to help secure the win.
LaVine leads the Bulls with 23.1 points per game, Nikola Vucevic adds 20.5 points per game, and White follows with 18.5 points per game.
The Bulls will look to avenge their 132-123 home loss to the Pacers on Dec. 6, in which Haliburton led six Pacers in double figures with 23 points, and LaVine scored 32 points.
